metadata.title: CVE-2017-5975 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Heap-based buffer overflow in the __zzip_get64 function in fetch.c inzziplib 0.13.62, 0.13.61, 0.13.60, 0.13.59, 0.13.58, 0.13.57, 0.13.56allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via a craftedZIP file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5975` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libzzip-0-13 - 0.13.62-2ubuntu0.1
zziplib-bin - 0.13.62-2ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: zziplib package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.13.62-2ubuntu0.1').
